question_text: Which statement accurately describes how USB-C enables support for multiple signal types such as DisplayPort and Thunderbolt?
answer_options: It uses separate pins for each signal type
It uses a firmware switch to reroute protocols
It supports alternate modes within the same connector
It physically adapts using modular connector ends
correct_answer: It supports alternate modes within the same connector
explanation: USB-C uses alternate modes to allow different protocols (like DisplayPort or Thunderbolt) over the same connector and cable infrastructure.
